meanings.definition: A protein produced by plasma cells that is used by the immune system to identify and neutralize pathogens such as bacteria and viruses.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that immunoglobulin helps our body fight off harmful germs.
meanings.sent2: The immunoglobulin in our blood works like a shield against dangerous invaders.
meanings.sent3: When the immunoglobulin saw the virus, it put on its superhero cape and went into action.
meanings.sent4: The immunoglobulin acted like a vigilant guardian, swiftly detecting and defeating the bacterial intruders.
meanings.sent5: Imagine immunoglobulin as tiny soldiers standing ready to protect us from invisible enemies.
